availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Taylor (Kenton County, Kentucky, clerk)

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Clerk in Covington, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant from June 13, 1861, to November 23, 1861. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from August 15, 1862, to April 22, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 7, p. 909.

Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 168.
